children.subject: There was some sort of system glitch that closed enrollments. I've now corrected that and enrollment is open again for the lecture and the 999 section.

Is there an enrollment block on CS C8? My phase I was earlier today, but I am already waitlisted for CS C8. As far as I can see, the only reserved seats are for freshmen and sophomores and I will be a sophomore next fall.
So does allowing time conflict also means that there will definitely be alternate final exam times too?
From an enrollment system perspective, there are no pre-requisites for getting into CS 88. The professor may have expectations however, so if you have concerns, check with him.

Does one have to have taken Data 8 specifically in Spring 2018 to be able to enroll in CS 88? I took Data 8 a while back, but still want to enroll in CS 88. I also don't see a mention of an enrollment restriction for CS 88 on schedule.berkeley.edu so I'm kind of confused.

The wait list will not be purged from non-CS/EECS majors (unless faculty requests it - which they have never done). Please keep in mind that our classes are very impacted and we have a large number of majors who will have priority over non majors.

Just because you remain on a wait list does NOT mean you will get into the course. Always have a back up plan!
So in future semesters, will the waitlist be purged from non-CS/EECS majors ?

They do their best but are bound by budget and classroom space constraints. I suspect that this semester CS 70 will not expand much further so I STRONGLY recommend that you make a backup plan in case you do not get in.
Does CS70 usually end up enrolling everyone off the waitlist like CS61A?
I'm posting a follow-up now but CS 61B was just expanded last night and will be webcast. Expansion of CS 61C is in the works but I cannot say how much it will expand nor exactly when.
I saw it was expanded by 105 seats but I was #76 and am still not enrolled. Didn't get an email from CalCentral & wouldn't hit the unit cap either. Do you know why that could have happened?
I'm resolving this. Please don't post in multiple places.
Will CS61B be expanded this semester to accommodate people from the waitlist? And will it be webcasted?

history.content:
This is the master list of announcements for F18 lower div CS classes.  General enrollment information is at the end of this post.

UPDATED class-specific information as of August 26, 2018.

  • CS 61A - This class has expanded to 2,000 seats and the wait list has been cleared. If you remain on the wait list, check to make sure you do not have a time conflict or too many units to be enrolled without exceeding 20.5 for the semester.

  • CS 61B - The wait list for this class was re-prioritized at the instructor's request. EECS majors and undeclared L&S students now have priority. If you fit one of those categories and haven't moved up the wait list, email: cs-enrollments@berkeley.edu.

UPDATED class-specific information as of August 20, 2018.

 

  • CS C8 – This class is now full and the wait list is CLOSED. There are a handful of seats that remain open and require instructor consent. If you do not have a permission code for this class, you will not be able to enroll into those seats. If you are wait listed for this course you are now waiting for enrolled students to drop in order to get into the class - no further expansion of the class will happen. If you are not even on the wait list there is no way you can enroll into this class during F18 and will need to make alternate plans. Much as we wish we could accommodate everyone, the demand is simply overwhelming our resources.

 

  • CS 10 - seats are still available in this class

  • CS 61A - This class has been expanded and will be webcast.

  • CS 61B - This class was recently expanded and will be webcast. 

  • CS 61C – Class JUST expanded by 200 seats...wait list should process changes around 6:30pm tonight. This class will be webcast. 

  • CS 70 – Class has been expanded.

  • CS 88 – Class fully enrolled with a short wait list. No discussions at this time about expanding the class.

The remainder of this post contains general enrollment information.

 

  1. To see who can enroll into CS lower div classes and when, read: https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy#lower

  2. Time Conflicts - NEW for F18: The enrollment system WILL ALLOW time conflicts between CompSci classes and other classes. However, even though CalCentral will allow enrollment into both classes, it is still the student’s responsibility to plan their schedule carefully. Departments and faculty are NOT required or expected to accommodate students’ schedule conflicts, and the Instructor of Record may decline to enroll or Instructor Drop a student from a class if they cannot be present for all schedule activities, including midterms and finals.

    Best practice is to check attendance policies for each class and to speak to the instructors before enrolling in time conflicted classes.

  3. Waitlist Processing:

  • We will NOT purge the waitlist of non-CS/EECS majors at the end of phase 1 this semester.

  • Wait lists are automatically processed in numerical order based on the waitlist position. A student’s major is NOT taken into consideration when the wait list is processed.

  • If enrolling the student into the class will put them over the maximum number of units, the system will also skip the student when processing the wait list. Units for wait listed classes count towards the upper unit limit: 13.5 phase 1, 17.5 phase 2, and 20 units over all.

  • Waitlisted students who have time conflicts will no longer be held on the waitlist and will now be processed in sequential order like any other student. (As in the past, not meeting a reserve cap or exceeding the unit limit will still prevent students from being enrolled from the wait list.)

    Students on the waitlist for a class are NOT guaranteed to get into the class and should make a reasonable back-up plan.

  1. 999 sections will be used for ALL lower division classes. These are faux sections that allow students to enroll in the lecture and the 999 section(s) only via Cal Central. 

    Since students no longer drop/re-enroll when they want to switch sections, they will no longer risk being bumped to the end of the waitlist when they need to make a change. Additionally, the 999 section has no scheduled day or time which reduces the number of time conflicts that must be processed online. It DOES mean that students need to be patient and wait until class starts to know which section they will actually attend.

    Students can still see the actual section days/times via classes.berkeley.edu


          Assignments to actual sections will be handled outside of Cal Central by faculty either:

  • During first lecture
  • Via communication from instructor to use alternate form (e.g. Google form)
  • Via course home page

          Assignments to actual sections will be handled outside of Cal Central by faculty either:

  • During first lecture
  • Via communication from instructor to use alternate form (e.g. Google form)
  • Via course home page

 

 

The remainder of this post will contain class-specific information that will be updated as more information becomes available.

 

  • CS C8 – This class is being managed by COMPSCI department this semester. Students should enroll into CS C8.

 

  • CS 10, 61A, 61B, and 61C – Students need to enroll into the lecture, 999 discussion section and the 999A lab section. See note above about how enrollment works.

  • CS 70 – Students need to enroll into the lecture and the 999 discussion section. See note above about how enrollment works.

  • CS 88 – Students enrolling in this class need to have taken CS C8 in SP18 or to be currently enrolled in CS C8. Students need to enroll into the lecture and the 999A lab section.

#pin
